subHeader: To know how FusionCharts works, it is important to understand the various components and concepts of a chart

content.header: Below are different sections with interactive annotated images describing various components and concepts of charts

annotations.annotationDesc: Outlines the color variation of the different gegraphical entities based on their values. An array consisting of objects with range of values along with the color code.
An array of objects where an individual object represents a geogrsphical area and the value associated with it.
id is the unique identifier for eacch location. For example, if you want to denote Africa, the value for the corresponding id must be AF and not AFR.

annotationLinks.linkDesc: We have a detailed Map Specification Sheets for all the maps that can be rendered using FusionCharts, where you can find the correct id of the maps you want to create.

annotations.annotationDesc: value brings the numerical significance to the geographical entity concerning the use-case mapping
